data.title: Good Chicago style pizza, good Romanian soups.
data.text: This place has it all, their pizza Chicago style is good. They serve daily at least one selection of Romanian soups, best one being their meatballs soup. Very friendly staff.

data.title: Great Lunch Special
data.text:
I ate here mid-week at the end of the lunch hour when I was in town for a work conference. The restaurant is located just off the street in a plaza area that offers outside seating, but it has its own indoor seating as well. 

I had the pizza lunch special which is two slices and a fountain drink for $6.50 including tax. The pizza is thick-crust (but not the fried-type of pan pizza that a lot of places have) and there are several multi-topping choices available. One of my slices was Mediterranean, but there were also a few other choices with at least 4 or 5 toppings. The slices are very generous, and I thought the flavor was good too, even though I was there after the lunch rush and got some slices that had been around for most of the lunch hour.

The service was friendly and very fast, so you should be able to get in and out quickly if you're in a rush. The only thing they could've improved would be if they put the slices in the oven for a minute or so after I ordered it to warm it up a little more. 

I rate restaurants on here based on how well they're executing on what they're trying to deliver. Papa Christo's offers tasty pizza very quickly with good portions and at a great value, and I'd definitely eat here again.

data.title: Fast, friendly service, good food, great prices
data.text: The first thing that struck me at Papa Christos was the diverse menu, which includes an array of salads and sandwiches, all at affordable prices. Then you are greeted by friendly faces and warm smiles. They prepare the food and bring it to your table, at which point you dig into a generously-sized prion of good food. I enjoyed the cold vegetarian sandwich, which had a lot of good flavors; it was full of vegetables, cheese, and a great dressing.

data.title: Great Value
data.text: This is one of the few places you can eat downtown where you can still eat a good lunch for under $10. I usually get the pizza special. The pizza is good (not great) and fresh. Crust is thicker and doughy (not your NYC style pizza). Services has always been good and they move things along efficiently. The inside seating area is really small, but I rarely actually have a problem getting a table.

data.title: Great spot, delicious pizza
data.text: I had the pizza special, which is 2 slices and a medium soda for $6. Overall, the pizza was pretty good. The crust is not your typical crust, it is thick and doughy. But if you like double dough or double crust, then you will like Papa Christo's crust. Additionally, the ingredients were fresh and delicious.
